item.description:
Vineet Sinha of architexa.com, who just last week graduated from MIT with a Ph.D. from CSAIL (congratulations!), will lead a discussion of Eclipse.

Vineet says:

"This talk covers the latest happenings in the Eclipse world and brings highlights from this year's EclipseCon. I will give an overview of the different aspects of Eclipse and provide updates of various Eclipse projects. Beyond the IDE, I will cover other major initiatives including the rich client Platform, the newly created Runtime Project, and demonstrate some innovative tooling built on Eclipse."

Click here for a more detailed abstract.

Our meetings are personal, engaging and everybody is sharing in the topic at hand. Presentations/discussions are held at MIT's EHS Office, 265 Massachusetts Ave, upstairs from the MIT Museum:

http://www.flickr.com...

After presentations we go out for drinks/food at The Asgard, located at 350 Massachusetts Avenue (at the corner of Mass. Ave. and Sidney St.)

Thank you to the many members that RSVP (one way or another). This helps your humble organizer to manage the crowd at the venues.

I hope to see you there.


-John
item.how_to_find_us: The entrance is a gray door to the right of the main Museum entrance. The number "265" is across the top of the door. Follow the Meetup signs.
item.why: IMPORTANT *** I've changed the time to 6:30pm and the venue to the MIT EHS conference Room (thanks John for offering this space *** We still intend to meet up socially after our presentation and discussion.
item.name: The Boston Java June 23rd Meeting: Eclipse
